events.body:
Compiles and works together with #9789.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9791/commits/5c8fd508112016c3821b71112270afe83e6949ac
To clarify: my GCC does not consider this to be a VLA, but at least some Clang versions do.
Well I think this makes the code clearer too, so it's a win in any case.

5c8fd508112016c3821b71112270afe83e6949ac gives same binaries with recent gcc on my arch.

utACK 5c8fd508112016c3821b71112270afe83e6949ac

issue.title: Introduce CHashVerifier + specialization of SipHash for 256 + 32 bit data
issue.body:
Avoid VLA in hash.h - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9791
e484652fc and e484652fc from Core#10195

issue.title: [PORT] threat warning on VLA as error if `--enable-werror` is specifed
issue.body:
As per title: we introduce `--enable-error` configure flag and to the set of warning turned into an error. Such flag at configure time will add the `-Werror=vla` flag at compile time. 

This is a port of:
 
bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9789
bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9791
